H0.text: Makes the object move is the effect that gravity always has on an object on Earth.

H1.text: Gravity makes an object stay still on Earth.

H2.text: Pushes the object upward is the effect that gravity always has on an object on Earth.

H3.text: Pulls the object downward is the effect that gravity always has on an object on Earth.

A4.text: gravity is an attractive force between any two bodies that is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

A5.text: The force of gravity experienced by objects on Earth's surface is the vector sum of two forces: (a) The gravitational attraction in accordance with Newton's universal law of gravitation, and (b) the centrifugal force, which results from the choice of an earthbound, rotating frame of reference.
